repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
This just finishes off https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/3952 by adding a test-case.

It's surprisingly hard to create a test-case for this. I had to allow bytes-to-string comparisons in the TreePath code (allowing bytes constants might be another possibility I think). I've confirmed that it fails on the current master and passes with the patch.

comment_data.body: I also snuck in this slight inprovement to `PrintTree`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -834,7 +834,7 @@ def repr_of(self, node):
                 result += "(name=\"%s\")" % node.name
             elif isinstance(node, ExprNodes.AttributeNode):
                 result += "(type=%s, attribute=\"%s\")" % (repr(node.type), node.attribute)
-            elif isinstance(node, ExprNodes.ConstNode):
+            elif isinstance(node, (ExprNodes.ConstNode, ExprNodes.StringNode)):

comment_data.body: I don't think I understand exactly what's needed from [these two comments](https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/3952#discussion_r564766368) on the other PR. So I haven't made the changes.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4424,6 +4424,8 @@ def _multiply_string(self, node, string_node, multiplier_node):
                 string_node.unicode_value = encoded_string(
                     string_node.unicode_value * multiplier,
                     string_node.unicode_value.encoding)
+            if not string_node.value.is_unicode:
+                build_string = bytes_literal

comment_data.body: Actually - I think I do understand so I've made the changes
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4424,6 +4424,8 @@ def _multiply_string(self, node, string_node, multiplier_node):
                 string_node.unicode_value = encoded_string(
                     string_node.unicode_value * multiplier,
                     string_node.unicode_value.encoding)
+            if not string_node.value.is_unicode:
+                build_string = bytes_literal

comment_data.body:
Shouldn't you encode `value` instead of decoding `attr_value`? (And only if it's `unicode` and not just `str`?)
How do you know that `attr_value` is really encoded in UTF-8 and not something else?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -167,6 +167,11 @@ def select(result):
                     continue
                 if attr_value == value:
                     yield attr_value
+                elif (isinstance(attr_value, bytes) and isinstance(value, str) and
+                        attr_value.decode("utf-8") == value):

comment_data.body: What about using `PyConstNode` instead? And maybe using `%r` for the value instead of `"%s"`?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -834,7 +834,7 @@ def repr_of(self, node):
                 result += "(name=\"%s\")" % node.name
             elif isinstance(node, ExprNodes.AttributeNode):
                 result += "(type=%s, attribute=\"%s\")" % (repr(node.type), node.attribute)
-            elif isinstance(node, ExprNodes.ConstNode):
+            elif isinstance(node, (ExprNodes.ConstNode, ExprNodes.StringNode)):

comment_data.body: This is also not going to work correctly in Py2, where `str` is `bytes` and `.encode()` will `.decode()` it first. If the `value` has some encoding other than `us-ascii`, then this implicit decoding will fail. Thus my suggestion that this should only be done for unicode strings and not Py2 `str`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -168,7 +168,7 @@ def select(result):
                 if attr_value == value:
                     yield attr_value
                 elif (isinstance(attr_value, bytes) and isinstance(value, str) and
-                        attr_value.decode("utf-8") == value):
+                        attr_value == value.encode()):

@@ -168,7 +168,7 @@ def select(result):
                 if attr_value == value:
                     yield attr_value
                 elif (isinstance(attr_value, bytes) and isinstance(value, str) and
-                        attr_value.decode("utf-8") == value):
+                        attr_value == value.encode()):

commit.message:
Handle constant folding for LanguageLevel 2 on Python 3

Ensure that when StrNode is a BytesLiteral, that we don't coerce it to unicode

Fixes https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/3951

Add test for string multiplication bug

Needed to change the TreePath slightly to allow bytes-to-str
comparison
Suggestions from review of other PR

Re-enabled commented-out test

It isn't necessary to show the bug, but it's worth testing anyway.

title: String constant folding (with test)
